review_text: This place is one of the best Air bNb places we ever stayed. It was decorated so cute, was clean, and had many special extra touches. There were fresh plants and flowers, a Magnolia cookbook that we made a couple recipes from, a portrait that ended up being the TV, board games, a lovely patio with ceiling fans, canvas grocery bags, umbrellas, and two bicycles. The kitchen was well stocked but also included an instant pot and a high-speed nutibullet blender. The bed was comfortable, and there were lots of throw blankets around. The shower was luxurious along with nice soaps and shampoo. It was conveniently located and easy to find. It was so much better and more comfortable than any hotel. Hosts were responsive. The worst part was we were only there for two nights... I could have stayed all summer. If we come again, this is definitely where we will book to stay again.

Our family of 2 adults and 2 rambunctious kids stayed at Sandy's rustic cottage. The cottage is very cozy, airy and styled with vintage finds and contemporary accessories and tech. All of the spaces in the cottage are like new or renovated. The bathroom is spacious and the shower is indulging. We enjoyed cooking in the open, stocked kitchen. There is a beautiful garden outside with birds chirping all day. The beds are comfy: the smaller bed has a firmer mattress, the bigger one is softer. The skylights in the roof fill the rooms with lots of light. Everything was exactly per description and even more charming in person. One note, we did not use the washer and dryer, which were in host's house due to COVID-19 self-isolation precautions.
A marina is a short walk around this area with historic houses. There are many supermarkets and New Haven parks within short drive. We did not check out any restaurants during our stay. Sandy and Rob were very discrete, communicative, and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

review_text:
OK - this is an easy one. Sandy's place is in a gorgeous part of New Haven in historic City Point. Very easy access on and off I-95 but given the historic nature of City Point I didn't hear the freeway. Sandy has missed nothing in raising the bar for an AirBnB stay - the cabin is superbly equipped with all of the latest conveniences. But the ambience is simply stunning - its like living in a mini library with great comfort in the bed rooms and lounge, a great sound system in Amazon's Alexa &internet TV and a 5 star bathroom!
I arrived into this little paradise after a 24 hr flight and to find the amazing Shell & Bones Oyster Bar and Grill only a few hundred metres walk was just perfect. It doesn't get much better. For those of you looking for a run there is quite a nice trail very close to the cabin - if you stick to the path and run to the end of the most eastern wharf you can just make 5 km return if you finish at City Point Kitchen - may as well stay for brunch.
Simply perfect - and I was here for work!

If you are looking to dine at any number of the fabulous multi-cultural restaurants in downtown New Haven and near Yale, we found both driving and taking an Uber or Lyft very convenient. There are also a number of markets near Yale to pick up any necessities for the fridge/freezer back at the cottage. Thanks to Sandy, we fell in love with New Haven!

review_text:
Sandy's place went way beyond my expectations. One bug-a-boo that I have had with all my Airbnb experiences is that the kitchens had mostly second hand pots, pans, knives, and it would be a stretch to prepare a whole meal. Well, this place has it all and then some. The retro steel sink and cabinets are fantastic as are the professional stove. Every pot imaginable as well as every small utensil that is very useful. I could actually live here. My other bug-a-boo is that all other rentals had knives that were dangerously dull and did not have a sharpener. Well Sandy's is well stocked with sharp knives and good quality as well.
The place is spacious, very tastefully decorated. New bathroom with great hot shower.
And a fire extinguisher! I would highly recommend staying here.

This is a review for the main house rather than cottage as the hosts asked us to stay there during landscaping work.
On the day of arrival we were informed that there was no power in the area due to a storm so had to find an alternative. The hosts did not refund the night that we couldnâ€™t stay, but Airbnb did as a goodwill gesture.
When we arrived we were met by Rob who was trying to resolve an alarm issue in the house due to the power outage - luckily he did so.
In the event we spent 16 hours in the house, but it was very stylish, spacious and comfortable and a shame we couldnâ€™t have been there as long as intended. Everywhere was very clean and the beds were comfortable and bathrooms lovely.
We were able to cook easily as there is a full kitchen and relax with Alexa and Netflix!! The welcome package was also great.
It was especially good for us to be able to leave our rental car in the driveway for 3 days to take a train to New York City and saved us a lot of effort finding secure parking or having to rent two cars.
Highly recommended and wish we could have stayed longer.

We loved everything about the place, especially all of the stylish furniture and eclectic animal decorations. Rob and Sandy were punctual with all communication over the course of the entire process. Alexa was also very helpful and fun to use while winding down for the evening!
In terms of location, it was very easy to get to downtown New Haven; just a short drive to the lovely Yale campus and surrounding museums. A big thank you to Rob and Sandy for all the extra unexpected amenities and treats! There was so much thought put into welcoming us for our arrival and when we checked out.

review_text: We stayed in this apartment for a month prior to a full-time move to New Haven. The apartment was exactly as pictured - no unhappy surprises after checking in! It is a 3rd floor walk-up but we didn't find the stairs a burden. All instructions were clear. Everything was spotless, the bathroom in particular is updated and modern, with a great shower. The kitchen has a dishwasher and small fridge, and there are two AC window units, which were handy during one week of high heat and humidity. There is a coin-op washer and dryer in the basement but we opted to take our clothes to a laundromat (the Wash-Tub in East Rock) to save having to do multiple trips walk up and down the stairs, and dig around for quarters. FYI, the neighborhood is close to I-91 so you hear traffic noise. Otherwise, the area is very walkable, and felt quite safe.

review_text: Truman is a great host, very responsive, and happy to offer recommendations and solutions to any issues. The place is recently remodeled, and the bathroom, bed and linens all felt new and clean. The house is old but well maintained, the kitchen had everything I needed for a long weekend stay, and the fridge was stocked up with a few basics when I got there - very nice of Truman to take the effort to do this! It was my first time in New Haven and the city overall didn't feel particularly safe after dark, especially the part of town where the house is (very few people walking, some dark streets in the neighborgood), but walking during the day was perfectly fine, and if you are driving this would probably be much less of an issue. All in all, a very good place to stay, it served my needs very well, and Truman is an exceptional host very willing to make it a good experience.

name: Maria
rating_info:

,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Okay, so to begin I am a wife and mother to a 2 year old and a 7 month old. On the spur of the moment my family and I decided to book a getaway , and spend Easter with loved ones in Connecticut. As a family of four we needed to prioritize functional accommodations (remember 2 very little humans) BUT we also wanted a place to stay that would make us never want to leaveâ€¦. And this is exactly how I would summarize our stay and experience! Our host Paul was INCREDIBLY thoughtful ( he purchased utensils specifically for my kids so we could be completely comfortable and at ease). Paul also made sure to include a playpen and safety gates for his smaller guests . He is gracious and made it clear that he was available for anything that we might need; also, he is a great resource to anyone who might not be familiar with New Haven. In addition to our host, the best part of our stay was of course was this HOUSE! If we didnâ€™t go or do anything else but stay in this house we still would have been very happy. The house is beautifully styled and furnished, with artistically modern touches. Geometrical and steel light fixtures adorn the walls and ceilings throughout the house, and bedrooms can be distinguished by the musically and sci-fi inspired art decor ( we stayed in the â€œJimi Hendrix roomâ€) You can rest your head next to Pink Floydâ€™ album cover or wake up with Darth Vaderâ€™s dark side to greet you. Not tired because your 2 year old decides sheâ€™s too excited for you to sleep? Thatâ€™s cool, pass Jim Morrison on the way to the heated screen room where you can sit and relax while she is distracted by the sweet greenery. Hungry much? Obviously and always is the answer in my family. The kitchen has every amenity/utensil created or imagined. It comes prepared for every walk of human; from the grill master to the microwave chef, it will have everything you need to prepare, cook, serve and enjoy your meals. My above all else feature that I loved about the house? The sunshine. Natural sunlight pours in and lights up every single room, but it can also be dialed back and effectively muted all together. On mornings when we werenâ€™t quite ready to be conscious, we could simply leave the shades down until the coffee did itâ€™s job. Overall, we are thrilled that we discovered this gem in New Haven, and look forward to planning our next stay here (if itâ€™s available:)

This is a very good value. I had no issues during my stay.
There's ample street parking, but it can get tight on street sweeping days. The southbound side sweeps on Mondays from 7 AM-3 PM. The northbound side sweeps on Tuesdays from 7 AM-3 PM. On those days, you'll need to exercise care in parallel parking and avoid blocking driveways.
Entering and leaving the property requires going up and down stairs both inside and outside the property. These aren't well lit in the dark, so be careful negotiating them.

Stayed over a week
review_text:
I stayed here for a few weeks for work.
The good:
-Katy is very nice and responsive / in the building and comes by to check in.
-Secure keypad/lock that is easy for check in
-Window unit ac (it was hot!)
-Nice kitchen facilities
The ok:
-This is a shared airbnb with several other guests. It's good value for money (which is why I gave it a mostly very high rating) but if you're a light sleeper, it's a roll of the dice who you will get as housemates. Week 1 was great. Week 2 one housemate kept weird hours and I slept very badly (yes I use earplugs). There are a few bedrooms - mine was #6 and was between the kitchen and bathroom so you really heard it when folks moved around. The other rooms might be a bit quieter.
-The bugs bite at night - Not sure how they get in - the front door? Gaps in the window ac? Cracked bathroom window? but I always woke up with many bites. New Haven / not airbnb's fault but pack long sleeves/pants to sleep in.
All in all - good place and would stay again.

This is my second time staying (def not my last!). Katy and Bill are such wonderful hosts! Bill was kind enough to help me with my luggage, and Katy gave me a heads up notice one of my days there about moving my car to avoid getting a parking ticket (which I ended up getting on account of me, smh). Besides that snafu, my stay was nothing short of wonderful. Bill and Katy made some great recommendations for restaurants (included in a lovely welcome card that they left for me), parking (for the most part) was easy-breezy (I was able to park directly in front of the house, a house up or down, or across the street), washer/dryer (coin-based) is located right in the basement and included detergent/dryer sheets, my roommates/flat mates were super friendly (usually Yale students, employees, or hospital staff), location is ideal and convenient, and the place is 100% clean and smells fresh. You will absolutely enjoy your stay, and I recommend 100%!
Bill & Katy â€” you guys are bomb dot com. I'll see u again real soon :)

review_text: This is an absolute gem. The host thought of everything! Although we brought most of our own food supplies, the kitchen is stocked with everything we would have needed for our 3 nights of snacks, coffee, tea, juices, milk, eggs, condiments and a bottle of wine - as well as a few meal options. Everything from the decor to the supplies and accessories is first class, clean and professionally decorated. It appears to have been recently remodeled and is as clean and comfortable as anyone could ever hope for. Beds are comfortable and bedding impeccable. Parking is conveniently located at the side rental entrance and is well lighted with security motion lamps. Door locks and overall security is top notch.... 2 1/2 baths are a total plus for a two-bedroom rental with large well stocked walk in showers and closets. It's an easy 1.5 mile walk to the center of Yale/downtown restaurants and theaters. I will stay here again if and when I'm in the area. Thank you Michael.

Stayed over a week
review_text: To me, a perfect Aibnb property stikes the balance between the space and comfort of staying in a friend's home and the touches and amenities of a luxury hotel. Michael's property nails this. The home is spacious, and well-appointed with great linens, towels, and a kitchen that contains just the right amount of items without being cluttered. The baths are really well done and stocked with Tommy Bahamas toiletries and little touches like a nightlight, shower cap, cotton balls, etc. Check in and entry to the home is really easy with a keypad. Great Tvs and other extras like extra pillows, blankets, iron, and luggage racks-- there's even bikes and helmets if you want to venture out. Oh...and everything you need for your first breakfast in the home without having to visit the grocery store. Definitely one of the most well-appointed properties I've had the pleasure to visit. And Michael is very responsive if you have a question. Will definitely return to when I visit New Haven.

review_text: Our stay at Michael's place exceeded our expectations. His home is lovely and was spotlessly clean. It's beautiful and tastefully decorated... very modern and upscale while also being very comfortable. Just the right balance. A few of the things we really loved: all the fun memorabilia and unique furnishings, the luxury toiletries and linens in the bathrooms, the well equipped kitchen, the comfortable beds, and the little notes here and there with clear instructions about how to operate everything from the dimmer switches to the Keurig machine. Nothing was overlooked. What we REALLY appreciated though, were the extra touches. Not only did Michael welcome us with a bottle of wine (so nice after hours in the car) but he also stocked the fridge and cupboards with breakfast essentials and all the fixings for coffee. We highly recommend Michael's home and plan to return at some point ourselves when we're next in CT.

review_text: This is easily the best Airbnb home I've ever stayed in. 1) Accuracy: The home is exactly as pictured, and in-fact was even more comfortable and wonderfully decorated than I expected. 2) Amenities: Alarm system available for optional use, bikes and helmets, hangers...that's just the start. Not to mention the KITCHEN amenities: fully stocked coffee and tea bar, fridge stocked with essentials (eggs, cream, milk, condiments, butter), pantry with essentials (pasta, mac and cheese, oils, spices)...BATHROOM amenities: shampoos, etc., hair dryers, hotel-like products. 3) Location: Perfectly situated right on the edge of Yale's campus, so you can easily walk to the center of the University and also feel a little separated from the night life. Very quiet. 4) Comfort: Beds and living spaces so spacious. Beds were so comfy, and I'm picky :). 5) Communication from owner: Owner was incredibly responsive. Even helped me with a mistake I made with the alarm system so quickly! He checked in on us to make sure we were all good numerous times and was flexible with check in. Wonderful overall. Would recommend to anyone needing a place to stay in New Haven.

Billy and Amyâ€™s place is perfect for visiting downtown New Haven and Yale. We live only a few blocks away, and had our parents staying in the apartment while they visited us; the space was central, accessible, and perfectly set up. Though our parents did not use the coworking space, it is also set up extremely thoughtfully and with everything you need for remote work. The bedrooms, bathroom, and kitchen are well appointed and have lots of little touches to make guests feel welcome.
Finally, Billy and Amy were amazing hosts: they were flexible and extremely helpful when my family accidentally left some things behind after checkout. They coordinated with us and did everything possible to make it easy for us to retrieve them; we were extremely grateful.
The apartment has everything you need for an enjoyable, easy, fun stay in downtown New Haven; we would definitely return!

review_text: We had an extended stay at this property and very much enjoyed the amenities, including workspaces (with accessories such as mouse, keyboard, laptop stand and a monitor ) that were separate from the bedrooms, a kitchen that is fully equipped with updated fixtures/appliances, and a washer/dryer in the unit. The property's location is in easy walking distance of Yale University hospitals and schools, as well as New Haven eating and shopping spots. Really good cafes, restaurants, and shops are just a few blocks away. Off-street parking is available, which is convenient if you have a car. I would definitely stay here again with my family!

review_text: Alton who is one of the hosts and who I always communicate with is very responsive. This was a second stay at one of his properties and the first one at this location. The driveway is very skinny and in very bad shape. I had a compact car which fits in, although, any larger cars would be a problem with the trash cans also there. This I think was not well described. The place in general is fine and kitchen is well equipped. Bathroom a little too small and I had WiFi issues the first day connecting. I was there for 4 days and it worked fine the other days. Overall, I felt that the first stay (Mansfield St) property which is right next door was a lot better property and more value for the price. The bedroom and bed were fine and clean. Linens were very good.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: It was great - everything as described. Overall, the apartment was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the window A/C was a lifesaver. Also the desk was perfect for working. Improvements would include unclogging the bathtub drain, providing toilet paper in the bathroom (not just in the bedroom), and blackout curtains in the bedroom. The multiple door codes was a little complicated but manageable - to lock the bedroom door you need to hold the "#" key. The hosts were responsive, helpful, and friendly. I felt safe in the neighborhood. Great value, especially if you can get a parking spot.

name: Judith
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
July 2023
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
After spending a month at the listing, I could say the overall experience was positive.
- Very good location in a neighborhood quiet and close to downtown.
- Very well equipped kitchen
- Very comfortable bed and quiet room
Communication with the owners is excellent and they respond very quickly with solutions.
As negative things I would highlight the inability to use the laundry machine ( panic to go down to that basement) but there is an excellent laundry room nearby. The other thing is that you are lucky with your colleagues as these can be noisy and bothered in the evenings.
In conclusion, a very good place for long stays with good value for money without great luxuries and recommended. I would repeat

name: Gayle
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
April 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My review is to be up front in the expectations of this listing. The room is just as described, clean modern furniture. It is a quiet area except for some road noise. It is a room on the 3rd floor with narrow stairs. You are sharing with a permanent tenant and possibly another airbnb guest. There are cameras in the common areas (kitchen and lounge area). The room itself has it's own locked door. The kitchen (I did not use because I didn't need to but probably wouldn't because of some of the cleanliness) and bathroom are shared. The bathroom I had to use but it was not kept for guests. One clean towel per person was provided which was not a problem. I hung them in our room to dry for the next day. No washrags or soap were provided.
The heat did not work. I found a space heater in the closet which sufficed for our room but the bathroom was cool when showering. I messaged Naomi late that evening and she responded the next day. She promptly had someone come fix the heat that day; however, on our third evening it was not working again (old system). We did not report it again since we were leaving.
There was a note taped to the bathroom door explaining that sleep was important, a calm atmosphere is needed, and to reduce the number of times you use the bathroom in the evening unless it is absolutely necessary. I believe the permanent resident posted this note.
All in all, it is a great value for a place to sleep.

If you go to this location, they have a cute smoothie place Solbol near by and a small park across the street. The apartment was spotless and so organized it was lovely. The kitchen has lots of pots and pans, but you would need to bring baking sheets/cupcake tins if needed. It does get a little loud at night due the hospital being close by and some neighbors upstairs wake up early in the morning. The amenities made this place even more amazing! We went to the 24-hour gym every night and had dinner on the rooftop at sunset it was absolutely gorgeous. I would recommend this stay for anyone who wants to have a relaxing stay this team did a great job! Thank you!

The location is great, you can walk to Yale, Walgreens, Coffee Shops, Union Station, everywhere. The place has everything, it is a dream! Full kitchen, lovely bedroom, great mattress and linens, the bathroom is great, and the living room is perfect! There is a washer and dryer center too. It is the perfect place to stay in New Haven, close to everything, I traveled by myself and I felt very safe, the building is top notch and full of luxury and amenities. You will have everything you need, Keurig, vanity essentials, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soft towels, everything! It is perfect if you want to work, there is a table, the sofa, and a bar in the kitchen for your laptop. Perfect for a weekend getaway or a long stay, the place is lovely, spotless, and has the best location. The hosts are great, it was a fabulous experience staying here! I will definitely come back!

We will definitely be staying here again and would recommend this place to anyone. Thank you Jhanice and Hyatus!

Apartment was clean and tidy. Some items needed attention (the sliding closet door was hard to work with!) but it was a nice little garden level apartment, perfect for a couple. We booked on Yale reunion weekend, so was on the pricey side. Easy parking right out front, and great communication from our hosts. It'd be nice if there was another sign above the toilet (instead of the flushing instructions) that was more "homey" and gave this apartment more of a unique feel, but that is a minor issue. In the end, it was a nice, clean, simple AirBnb in a good location.

name: Peter
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Unit was spotless and exactly as described. Communication and instructions for access and departure was very friendly and comprehensive. Apt was ideal for visiting our son at Yale, walking distance to north side of science campus through quiet residential neighborhood, with safe, well treed and shaded streets. Parking easy on street and behind building. The apartment was obviously renovated with care recently and well furnished with everything we needed, with lots of handy extras like extra bedding, hair care products, a well equipped full kitchen with good assortment of kitchen basics including seasonings, sugar, tea, coffee, etc. All appliances were new and worked well, including full stove with oven as well as microwave, drip coffee maker, toaster, etc. Internet very fast with good TV service. Lots of windows plus multiple skylights with blinds make unit bright and cheerful, with attractive furnishings and hardwood floors. Unit is on third floor which means several stairs up as described accurately, but we had no issues with this; stairs were well lit and again attractive hardwood, and result is you occupy the top unit which is especially bright and quiet. The week we were here New Haven was especially hot and humid, reaching over 95 deg most days, but the new central AC in apartment was brilliant, capable of making the entire space as cool as anyone might want despite high temperatures outside. All in all one of the best apt shares we have found, well done!

review_text:
My stay here was absolutely amazing and incredibly relaxing due to all of the thought that the hosts have put into the unit. The apartment is beautifully decorated and filled with literally everything I could have needed during the stay. The hosts were super quick to respond when I had an issue connecting to the WiFi and it was nice to know that if I needed anything they would be responsive and quick to help!
The skylights and many windows in the apartment create the most beautiful atmosphere throughout the day and all of the windows and skylights have blinds you can use at night for privacy.
For anyone traveling during the covid-19 era, I felt more than comfortable staying here in terms of this. The unit appears to be on its own hvac unit and is completely separate from the other units in the building with the exception of a shared hallway to get to the door to the unit entrance. The apartment was also sparkling clean when I arrived!
Thank you so much to the hosts for making it such a lovely experience and I hope that I find myself back in CT to stay again sometime!

name: Henry
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2021
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Shelley's AirBNB is absolutely beautiful! Located about a 3 minute drive from Yale University, this listing really is a hidden gem. We were looking for a nice getaway during New Years and found Shelley's 3rd floor skylight apartment. It completely exceeded our expectations! The inside is beautifully decorated with high ceilings and pleasant dÃ©cor. Since it's on the top floor, each room has a spacious skylight window in the ceiling that allows a good amount of natural light in but not so much that it's blinding. At night, these skylights can either be closed using a touchpad on the wall which is really convenient, or used to gaze at the stars from the comfort of the apartment. The kitchen is extremely spacious, with plenty of counterspace, a gas stove, a dishwasher, and a fridge with a water/ice dispenser. The living room is definitely the center of the listing, with a nice big Roku TV already equipped with streaming services on it. The couch is comfy and the coffee table is nice and sturdy while you settle in and watch TV. The bedrooms are spacious and both have big, soft beds that are irresistible to just climb into after a long day. The bathroom has a nice sink with good counterspace, and the shower has great water pressure. On top of that, the bathroom has its own skylight right over the shower! There is a driveway with a small back parking lot and there is street parking. While our experience at the AirBNB was amazing, having Shelley as our host made it unforgettable. Shelley was extremely responsive from the moment we booked the listing until the last day. We so appreciated her hospitality and kindness during our stay. She gave us updates about anything that might be going on around/in the house, like gutters being installed or walls in the hallways being painted. She was very transparent about everything and responded to any questions we had within an hour or two. All in all, we absolutely loved our stay there and we'd be so happy to go there again!

So big and airy and bright, with windows on all sides, including overhead - yes the skylights are real, gorgeous, and there are about 6 of them. The kitchen is dreamy, and everything else is in order. I was there for 3 nights with my partner and it was a perfect escape. We were wary of traveling during covid, but this place felt so clean and trustable. It's tucked away on a quiet street, which was fine because we had a car. The views out the back window at sunset are incredible because you can see for miles. Great view of West Rock. Good couch/tv setup, lots of bathroom amenities and toiletries, good, easy laundry. This was airbnb-ing at its best.

name: Ethan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,

Stayed over a week
review_text:
This was the best experience I've ever had staying at an Airbnb.
First -- the space. It was spacious without losing any charm, the furniture and decorations were elegantly minimal without feeling dorm-y, and the kitchen was large, gorgeous and so fun to cook in. It's the only experience I've had where the place is even nicer than the pictures. The bedrooms were both large and very comfortable. And for being in a city like New Haven, it was refreshingly and serenely quiet!
As for the host -- Colin was extremely helpful and responsive to everything that came up during our stay. He even brought us a care package. At one point the water was an odd color -- something was going on with the city -- and Colin immediately responded and even offered to bring us whatever. He went above and beyond the call of duty! (The water issue had nothing to do with Colin, but was fixed quickly anyway).
Overall it was the exact restful and restorative place to stay that I was looking for. I can't recommend it enough.
